name: VPC
description: Creates a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with the CIDR block that you specify.

properties.name: CidrBlock
properties.description: The CIDR block you want the VPC to cover. For example: "10.0.0.0/16".

properties.name: EnableDnsSupport
properties.description: Specifies whether DNS resolution is supported for the VPC. If this attribute is true, the Amazon DNS server resolves DNS hostnames for your instances to their corresponding IP addresses; otherwise, it does not. By default the value is set to true.

properties.name: EnableDnsHostnames
properties.description: Specifies whether the instances launched in the VPC get DNS hostnames. If this attribute is true, instances in the VPC get DNS hostnames; otherwise, they do not. You can only set EnableDnsHostnames to true if you also set the EnableDnsSupport attribute to true. By default, the value is set to false.

properties.name: InstanceTenancy
properties.description: The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) for this VPC.

attributes.name: CidrBlock
attributes.description: The set of IP addresses for the VPC. For example, 10.0.0.0/16.

attributes.name: DefaultNetworkAcl
attributes.description: The default network ACL ID that is associated with the VPC. For example, acl-814dafe3.

attributes.name: DefaultSecurityGroup
attributes.description: The default security group ID that is associated with the VPC. For example, sg-b178e0d3.
